alert.note: Alert for Central Carbon County; Laramie Valley; North Snowy Range Foothills; Southwest Carbon County; Upper North Platte River Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 12 at 10:53PM MST until January 13 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST SATURDAY... ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST TUESDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected. Additional snow accumulations up to 2 inches. For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 40 below zero. * WHERE...Central Carbon County, North Snowy Range Foothills, Southwest Carbon County, Upper North Platte River Basin and Laramie Valley. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 5 AM MST Saturday. For the Wind Chill Warning, until 11 AM MST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions and poor visibility at times. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Central Carbon County; Laramie Valley; North Snowy Range Foothills; Southwest Carbon County; Upper North Platte River Basin
